abstract: BayernLB, one of the German regional banks that got into the most trouble during the financial crisis, said a study it had commissioned found its former management team was liable for the disastrous decision to buy a controlling stake in Hypo Alpo Adria, an Austrian lender that had to be nationalized late last year.
snippet: BayernLB, one of the German regional banks that got into the most trouble during the financial crisis, said a study it had commissioned found its former management team was liable for the disastrous decision to buy a controlling stake in Hypo Alpo...
lead_paragraph: BayernLB, one of the German regional banks that got into the most trouble during the financial crisis, said a study it had commissioned found its former management team was liable for the disastrous decision to buy a controlling stake in Hypo Alpo Adria, an Austrian lender that had to be nationalized late last year.

headline.main: Report Faults Former BayernLB Managers in Failed Bank Deal
